alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 10:45PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN NEWTON...MCDONALD AND BARRY COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM CST... At 1045 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Noel, or 7 miles south of Pineville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Sugar Creek State Park, Roaring River State Park, Monett, Cassville, Noel, Purdy, Pineville, Exeter, Wheaton, Butterfield, Washburn, Lanagan, Fairview, Pioneer, Stella, Stark City, Jenkins, Wayne, Mcdowell, and Pleasant Ridge. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
